data.title: Cheap Chick in the City
data.text:
Editor‚Äôs Note: Again, thank you to all who found me after my appearance on #TheRehearsal with Nathan Fielder. Unfortunately, the Cheap Chick in the City has been REALLY stressed/busy lately and will be traveling/helping to celebrate her mom‚Äôs milestone birthday this coming week, BUT she managed to post some NYC w/e events, Her mom‚Äôs bday festivities are happening ALL w/e, so she is not going to publish a new post with full NYC events on Monday, (The Cheap Chick isn‚Äôt quite sure what she is going to do yet, may be repeat of last week‚Äôs post‚Ä¶) She could also urgently use ANY financial assistance, esp since she has to move yet again on September 1st, you can provide, supporting her/the ws or ‚Äúbuying her a cup of coffee or orange juice, no pulp üòâ‚Äù you can Venmo her via @Patricia-Couture-3.

Sorry no pics, but now on to this week‚Äôs NYC events!

Saturday August 10th, 2024

‚ÄúBronx Hip Hop Day‚Äú

9 a.m. to 8 p.m.

P.S./I.S. 224345 Brook Avenue, The Bronx

‚ÄúCelebrating all the elements of Hip Hop with Demonstration, teaching, panels and performances.‚Äù

Cost: Free! For more info and to get tkts, go here,

‚ÄúIntroductory Trail Running‚Äù

9 to 11 a.m.

Greenbelt Nature Center in Blood Root Valley, 700 Rockland Avenue at Brielle Avenue, Staten Island

‚ÄúAn introductory 3 mile run with short 15 minute walks to warm up and cool down. Perfect for anyone looking to learn how to stay healthy and safe while running on trails in the Greenbelt.

Additional instructions for participants: Bring comfortable running shoes and attire and water to stay hydrated.‚Äù

Cost; Free! Get tkts here.

‚ÄúBook Swap‚Äù

10 a.m. to 12;30 p.m.

Epiphany Library, 228 East 23rd Street, Manhattan

‚ÄúBring one or more books to swap with other book lovers. Price of admission is one book to swap. Please bring clean books, no ripped pages, and in good condition! Limit to one bag or box of books to trade at a time. All genres and ages accepted. This event will be in person and take place in the YA area.‚Äù

Cost: Free! (one book)

‚ÄúCommunity Science Seining‚Äù

10 a.m. to 12 p.m.

Pier 4 Beach in Brooklyn Bridge Park, Brooklyn

‚ÄúDiscover the amazing biodiversity of the East River as Brooklyn Bridge Park staff and marine biologists use a seine net to catch-and-release incredible organisms that live below that water‚Äôs surface. Be ready for exciting discoveries! All ages are welcome at this free event.‚Äù

Cost; Free!

‚ÄúDragon Fest Panda Day #2‚Äù

10 a.m. to 6 p.m.

7 Washington Square North, Manhattan

‚ÄúAn annual outdoor Chinese food & culture festival with experiential activities, tastings, and market fairs.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúCameras and Coffee: Community Meet-Up‚Äù

11 a.m. to 12 p.m.

International Center of Photography, 79 Essex Street, Manhattan

‚ÄúConnect with ICP‚Äôs community during our monthly Cameras and Coffee social meet-up for photographers, collectors, and camera enthusiasts! During the event, grab a La Colombe coffee and pastries, available in the ICP caf√©.‚Äù

Cost: Free! To get tkts, go here.

‚ÄúMAD Backyard Block Party‚Äù

11 a.m. to 3 p.m.

Museum of Arts and Design, Jerome and Simona Chazen Building, 2 Columbus Circle, Manhattan

‚ÄúJoin us for an unforgettable Block Party, where fun, creativity, and community come together! This event will be packed with exciting activities for all ages and is free with registration. The Block Party will take place in MAD‚Äôs ‚Äúbackyard‚Äù on 58th Street between Broadway and Eighth Avenue.

Cost: ‚ÄúFree with registration.‚Äù For more info and to get tkts, go here.

‚ÄúBankra Caribbean Culture Festival‚Äù

12 to 8 p.m.

Great Lawn in Archie Spigner Park, Queens

‚ÄúThe Bankra Caribbean Culture Festival features traditional folk forms and experiences from different Caribbean territories.

Inherited from the Twi language of Ghana (boankra), a bankra is a large, woven basket made of indigenous materials in the islands of the Caribbean and is often carried or used as a display for a wide variety of produce, usually colorful and tantalizing to the eyes.

This is exactly what this festival replicates: the largesse and beauty of the folk culture represented from each island.‚Äù

Cost; Free!

‚ÄúEast Harlem Giglio Feast‚Äù

12 to 11 p.m.

114th-116th St. along Pleasent Ave., Manhattan

Celebrate the 115th anniversary of the feast with plenty of Italian entertainment inc music, food, games, rides, and more.

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúCitypark‚Äôs PuppetMobile Presents Cinderella Samba‚Äù

1 p.m.

West 135th Street Plaza in St. Nicholas Park, Manhattan

‚ÄúJoin NYC Parks and the Cityparks PuppetMobile for Cinderella Samba! The lively production features an original musical soundtrack that brings samba center-stage; handcrafted Carnaval festival floats on parade; and one-of-a-kind marionettes donning their most vibrant celebration costumes.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúEquity Library Theater Summer Play Festival‚Äù

1 p.m.

Harry Belafonte 115th Street Library, 203 West 115th Street, Manhattan

‚ÄúCome by the library to see some exciting plays! Equity Library Theater will be presenting short comedies by upcoming new writers from around the globe. Seating is limited, so be sure to arrive on time.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúInstant Shakespeare: ‚ÄòHenry VI'‚Äù

1 p.m.

Yorkville Library, Meeting Room, 222 East 79th Street, Manhattan

‚ÄúThe Instant Shakespeare Company presents free readings of ALL of Shakespeare‚Äôs plays annually. Join us for their dramatic reading of Henry VI. All ages are welcome.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúThe World‚Äôs Fair Adventure Quest‚Äù

1 p.m.

Unisphere in Flushing Meadows Corona Park, Queens

‚ÄúJoin the Rangers for this exciting orienteering and history scavenger hunt adventure using the remaining monuments from the 1939 and 1964 World‚Äôs Fairs in Flushing Meadow Park as the answers to historic clues. Participants will form teams and navigate the park using the clues as their guide as to discover history and gain an new appreciation for Queens‚Äô flagship park.‚Äù

Cost; Free!

‚ÄúAnimal Advocacy & The Arts‚Äù

2 p.m.

Seward Park Library, 192 East Broadway, Manhattan

‚Äú‚ÄúAnimal Advocacy and the Arts‚Äù is a captivating exploration into the symbiotic relationship between creativity and animal advocacy. The talk spans literature, visual art, and cinema, including works by writers Virginia Woolf and George Orwell, photographer Ravi Agarwal, and ethical discussion of films such as Bong Joon-ho‚Äôs Okja and Pixar‚Äôs Finding Nemo. The lecture will be followed by a screening of the recently showcased short film How Do You Milk an Almond? ‚Äî a whimsical stick-puppet musical loosely based on real-life lawsuits, providing an entertaining and reflective portrayal of current events. This new short film has received early praise from prominent filmmakers in animal advocacy, including the director of Cowspiracy, Keegan Kuhn (executive produced by Leonardo DiCaprio) and the director of The Animal People, Denis Henry Hennelly (executive produced by Joaquin Phoenix).‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúPotluck at Ashford Learning Garden‚Äù

2 to 6 p.m.

Ashford Learning Garden, 341 Ashford Street, East New York, Brooklyn

‚ÄúCome to Ashford Learning Garden and enjoy a potluck day! The garden group invites everyone to come in and have some fun. Explore and enjoy this newly renovated garden and find out what the garden group has scheduled for this year. There will be games, music, and food. Please remember to bring a dish that you would like share (please note ingredients in your dish) or game you would like to play.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúReel to Read Movies: The Lady Vanishes (1938)‚Äù *Cheap Chick Recommends*

2 p.m.

Stavros Niarchos Foundation Library (SNFL), 455 Fifth Avenue, Manhattan

‚ÄúThe Lady Vanishes (1938)

While travelling in continental Europe, a rich young playgirl realizes that an elderly lady seems to have disappeared from the train. Directed by Alfred Hitchcock.

1938 | PG | 97 minutes,‚Äô

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúHindu Lamp Ceremony‚Äù *Cheap Chick Recommends*

3 to 7:30 p.m.

Pebble Beach in Brooklyn Bridge Park, Brooklyn

‚ÄúJoin Brooklyn Bridge Park Conservancy at their 12th annual Hindu Lamp Ceremony at Brooklyn Bridge Park. Dance artist and educator Aeilushi Mistry brings peace and harmony to the community as she performs the traditional Hindu Aarti ceremony at Brooklyn Bridge Park‚Äôs Pebble Beach.

This event is a free walk-up event open to all; no advance registration required. This event is subject to change to weather or other extenuating circumstances.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúWorld Steelpan Appreciation Day‚Äù

3 to 8 p.m.

Harbor View Lawn ‚Äì Brooklyn Bridge Park, Pier 1 ‚Äì Brooklyn Bridge Park, Brooklyn

‚ÄúJoin to celebrate and experience the sounds and tastes of Caribbean culture!‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúPaul Gagner ‚Äì ‚ÄòThe Cut of My Jib‚Äô Opening‚Äù

6 to 8 p.m.

Hashimoto Contemporary, 54 Ludlow St, Manhattan

‚ÄúHashimoto Contemporary is pleased to present The Cut of My Jib, a new body of work by Brooklyn-based artist Paul Gagner.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúCharlotte Adig√©ry & Bolis Pupul | Sinkane | Ushka‚Äù

7:30 p.m. (‚ÄúDoors 6:30pm/Show 7:30pm‚Äù)

Prospect Park Bandshell in Prospect Park, Brooklyn

‚ÄúCharlotte Adig√©ry & Bolis Pupul will transport you into a world of thought-provoking beats and exhilarating melodies. Defying conventions, the electrifying duo navigates issues like cultural appropriation and post-colonialism with infectious synth concoctions and an impressive ease. Known for their smash hit debut album Topical Dancer, which topped many critics‚Äô ‚ÄúBest of‚Äù lists in 2022, their dynamic live shows are considered a do-not-miss. Sinkane will open, bringing his signature genre-bending style that infuses pop, funk, and electronic elements with the soulful rhythms of Sudan. DJ and multidisciplinary artist USHKA will kick off the nightspinning a wide range of diasporic club music.‚Äù

Cost: Free! ‚Äú**RSVP to let us know you‚Äôre coming and be entered for a chance to win two VIP tent passes! Sponsored by Bud Light**‚Äù Get tkts here.

Take a ‚ÄúPark Avenue Sculpture Stroll‚Äù today during Summer Streets, 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. Stop by ‚ÄúThe Grand Lawn, the rest stop will have lawn games, food, and refreshing drinks from GCT retailers.‚Äù

‚ÄúCatch live music at Pershing Square Plaza this Saturday from 12 p.m. to 3 p.m, featuring Judd Nielsen and the Neighborhood Crew.‚Äù (GCT)

There are some free screenings (+ a performance) today @ The Museum of the City of New York re the ‚ÄúChanging the Face of Democracy: Shirley Chisholm at 100‚Äù @ 1:15 p.m. and 4 p.m.

The ‚ÄúBlues BBQ Festival‚Äù is today from 1 to 9 p.m. @ Pier 76 in Hudson River Park!

Sunday August 11th, 2024

‚ÄúVernam Barbadoes Preserve Coastal Cleanup & Seine Netting‚Äù

9 a.m. to 12 p.m.

Rockaway Freeway Dog Park in Rockaway Freeway, 83-02 Beach Channel Drive, Queens

‚ÄúVolunteer with the Stewardship Team to protect coastal areas in Vernam Barbadoes Preserve! Volunteers will help us remove the debris from the coastline creating a healthier ecosystem. We will also use a seine net to catch, observe and release some of the marine life of Jamaica Bay. Due to the strenuous nature of this event, it is not recommended for volunteers under the age of 14. Volunteers must be comfortable walking on uneven terrain. Face masks may be worn at your discretion. Come dressed in sturdy boots or shoes, long sleeves, long pants, and clothing that can get dirty. Space is limited and registration is required. Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by a chaperone. To sign up a group of 10 or more volunteers please reach out to stewardship@parks.nyc.gov.‚Äù

Cost: Free! Get tkts here.

‚ÄúSpotted Lanternfly Trap Building with NYC H20‚Äù

10 a.m. to 12 p.m.

Greenbelt Nature Center in Blood Root Valley, 700 Rockland Avenue at Brielle Avenue, Staten Island

‚ÄúJoin NYC H2O at the Greenbelt Nature Center to build traps to stop the spread of invasive spotted lanternflies.Cost: Free! Get tkts here.

‚ÄúWaterfront Walks‚Äù (This event repeats every 2 weeks on Sunday between 6/2/2024 and 10/20/2024.)

10;30 a.m.

Pier 1 in Brooklyn Bridge Park, Brooklyn

‚ÄúJoin Brooklyn Bridge Park Conservancy for a free walking tour of Brooklyn Bridge Park! Learn about the history of the Brooklyn waterfront, the Park‚Äôs sustainable design, and how the Park came to life. Waterfront Walks are held every other Sunday through October at 10:30 AM, starting from Pier 1.

Not an early bird? Come to a Sunset Waterfront Walk, which are offered twice monthly on Tuesdays and Sundays from May to October starting at Pier 1 at 6:30 PM.

All walking tours are free and weather dependent. RSVP‚Äôs are required, as guests will be notified if there are cancellations or delays due to weather. Wear comfortable shoes, as these tours last approximately one hour. All tours meet outside Van Leeuwen at Fulton Ferry Landing.

All walking tours are free and weather dependent. RSVP‚Äôs are required, as guests will be notified if there are cancellations or delays due to weather. Wear comfortable shoes, as these tours last approximately one hour. All tours meet outside Van Leeuwen at Fulton Ferry Landing.‚Äù

Cost: Free! Get tkts here.

‚ÄúNature‚Äôs Workshop: Natural Dyes‚Äù

11 a.m. to 12 p.m.

Lawn Area in Herbert Von King Park, Greene Avenue and Marcy Avenue, Brooklyn

‚ÄúJoin the Urban Park Rangers in using natural materials to tie-dye in vibrant colors. Bring your own white cotton clothes or receive a free handkerchief or tote bag to dye‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúBirding: Raptors‚Äù

11 a.m.

Freshkills North Park Entrance in Freshkills Park, 350 Wild Avenue, Staten Island

‚ÄúOur Urban Park Rangers will guide you to the best viewing spots in New York City to see birds of prey. Birding programs are appropriate for all skill levels and beginners are welcome. Join the Urban Park Rangers as we explore Freshkills‚Äô marshy ecosystem and determine what kind of raptors make it their home.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúPride Hike: Nature Is For All‚Äù

11 a.m. to 1 p.m.

The Overlook in Forest Park, Queens

‚ÄúLearn more about queer way that nature has evolved in parks. Rangers will provide a fun and inclusive space for the LGBTQ+ community while hiking on the Orange Trail in Forest Park. During the hike, Rangers will talk about plants and animals that live in the park and why it is important to create safe spaces for everyone in the great outdoors.‚Äù

Cost; Free!

‚ÄúEast River Ecology‚Äù

1 to 3:30 p.m.

Play Area in Twenty-Four Sycamores Park, Manhattan

‚ÄúExplore the East Midtown Greenway. Rangers share the local ecology and natural history of the East River and highlight the resilient design of the new park and greenway.‚Äù

Cost; Free!

‚ÄúThe Four Corners of Crotona‚Äù

1 to 2:30 p.m.

Crotona Nature Center in Crotona Park, Crotona Park East and Charlotte Street, Bronx

‚ÄúJoin the Rangers on a long walk through the largest park in the South Bronx! Explore all four quadrants of Crotona Park, known for its serene views, unique wildlife, and important history.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúNature‚Äôs Workshop: Printmaking in the Park‚Äù

1 to 2:30 p.m.

Blue Heron Nature Center in Blue Heron Park, 222 Poillon Avenue, Staten Island

‚ÄúJoin the Urban Park Rangers as they teach you some fun and easy printmaking techniques. Printmaking is one of the oldest art forms and the original way of creating multiples of the same image. Rangers will show you how to replicate these techniques without using harmful chemicals or large machinery, yet still creating some beautiful artwork.‚Äù

Cost; Free! Get tkts here.

‚ÄúDays Afield on Staten Island‚Äù

2 to 3 p.m.

Greenbelt Nature Center in Blood Root Valley, 700 Rockland Avenue at Brielle Avenue, Staten Island

‚ÄúStaten Island OutLOUD celebrates the summer season and explores the writing of Island naturalist William T. Davis (1862-1945).‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúGreat Jazz on the Great Hill‚Äù

3:30 p.m.

Great Hill, Central Park, Manhattan

‚ÄúJazzmobile and the Central Park Conservancy present Great Jazz on the Great Hill! Enjoy an amazing lineup of world-renowned jazz performers while lounging or swing dancing in the Park. Bring a picnic blanket, snacks, and your dancing shoes for this fun, free event!

All ages are welcome.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúAfribemb√© Festival‚Äú

4:30 to 6:30 p.m.

Grant‚Äôs Tomb, Morningside Heights, Manhattan

‚ÄúThis year, we are thrilled to join forces with Harlem Week to bring our Pan-African festival to this historic celebration of the rich culture of our community, providing Harlem with an even more powerful experience.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúChinatown Block Party‚Äù

4:30 to 8:30 p.m.

Mott & Mosco Streets, Manhattan

‚ÄúFor our season finale, we‚Äôre bringing dancer-DJs Gia Fu x YiuYiu Áë∂Áë∂ back together for a Chinese x Afro-Latin music crossover to close us out for the summer! Remember to bring along any special garments and textile remnants for this season‚Äôs interactive art installation, With Flying Colors by Annika Cheng. These recycled textiles will be incorporated into a series of banner flags that will be flown over Corky Lee Way during future block parties. With Flying Colors seeks to honor Chinatown garment workers and the people who love and wear the clothing that speaks to the world about who we are.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúHIP TO HIP THEATRE COMPANY: ‚ÄòTHE WINTER‚ÄôS TALE'‚Äù

5 p.m.

Socrates Sculpture Park, Queens

‚ÄúKing Leontes falsely accuses his pregnant wife of infidelity with his best friend. Consumed by jealousy, he makes a series of catastrophic decisions that tear his family apart and leaves his newborn daughter abandoned. Sixteen years later, can time bring healing and reconciliation?‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúWBLS 50th Anniversary: Jon B and Funk Flex‚Äù

5 p.m. (Doors)

Coney Island Ampitheater, 3052 West 21 Street, BK

‚ÄúWBLS has been holding it down as the center of soul and R&B in New York City for decades. For this throwback jam in Coney Island, it assembles a collection of R&B stars from the late ‚Äò80s and ‚Äò90s sure to trigger nostalgic notions of love and tenderness, hosted by the legendary radio DJ Funk Flex.‚Äù

Cost: Free! For more info, go here.

The ‚ÄúNational Dominican Day Parade‚Äù is today @ Noon and runs on Sixth Avenue

from 37th St to 55th St, in Midtown, Manhattan.

There‚Äôs a special ‚ÄúOlympics Closing Ceremony‚Äù @ Rock Center today @ 2 p.m.

Today is the last day to enjoy free drop-in improv classes @ The Second City New York! (Also avail on Sat)

The ‚Äú43rd Annual Battery Dance Festival‚Äù ‚Äì In-Person and Via Livestream‚Äù kicks off today and runs thru Saturday August 17th, 2024!

**********************************************************************************************************

‚ÄúPBS Great Performances: Merry Wives

Streaming until Monday, September 30 for FREE.

Free summer theatre season is coming to an end, which makes it the perfect time to revisit Merry Wives, Jocelyn Bioh‚Äôs fabulous one-act adaptation of the Bard‚Äôs The Merry Wives of Windsor, recorded live at The Public Theater‚Äôs Shakespeare in the Park in 2021. Set in modern-day Harlem with ladies‚Äô man Falstaff (Broadway vet Jacob Ming-Trent) attempting to woo two married West African immigrants, the show is an exuberant romp that celebrates broad comedy and Black joy. Saheem Ali directs an all-Black cast in this laugh-out-loud comedy‚Ä¶‚Äù (TDF)

###

All events were available @ time of posting. The Cheap Chick in the City is not responsible if events become sold out.

The Cheap Chick in the City will continue to tweet via @cheapchicknyc, so be sure to check there for SOME cheap and non-free things to do in New York City. Apologies for lack of Tweets recently, The Cheap Chick is working on it!

The Cheap Chick in the City is also available for special personalized messages etc. tips, advice, and ideas/suggestions for cheap and free things to do via the Cameo app including trip/vacation/wedding planning, birthdays, anniversaries, graduations, and doing cheap and free things in your hometown!

P.S. And yes folks, I am VERY real üôÇ

(Image Source: Wikipedia.org)

Editor‚Äôs Note: Again, thank you to all who found me after my appearance on #TheRehearsal with Nathan Fielder. The Cheap Chick in the City could still REALLY use your help, esp right now as she is struggling to pay July/August rent/bills, and since she only recently started a new job and NOW has to move again by September 1, so if you want to buy her a cup of coffee or a cup of orange juice, no pulp üòâ or just support the website, you can Venmo her via

@Patricia-Couture-3, EVERY little bit helps, thank you!

Here‚Äôs a link to my recent post, which still has some great free NYC summer events! And here‚Äôs a link to a previous post, which also has lots of great summer events in NYC.

Saturday August 3rd, 2024

‚ÄúBrooklyn Beach Sports Festival‚Äù (Rain Date: Sunday, August 4, 2024)

10 a.m. to 5 p.m.

Coney Island Beach, West 10th Street Boardwalk Entrance, Brooklyn

‚ÄúKick off your flip flops and come play at the beach ‚Äì the Brooklyn Beach Sports Festival is back! NYC Parks is partnering with National Calisthenics Awards to host competitive and non-competitive activities.‚Äù

Cost: Free! For more info, go here.

‚ÄúGreenbelt Native Plant Center Gardening‚Äù

10 a.m. to 1 p.m.

Greenbelt Native Plant Center, 3808 Victory Blvd, Staten Island

‚ÄúJoin the Greenbelt Native Plant Center staff for a gardening day! Tasks may include transplanting plants into bigger pots, weeding, seeding, moving potted plants, and other outdoor nursery activities. Volunteers in attendance may also help with GNPC‚Äôs new volunteer vegetable garden program. Please come prepared for inclement weather outdoors, sturdy footwear, and long-sleeved shirts that can get dirty. It is also recommended to wear a hat and bring sunscreen. Space is limited and registration is required. Volunteers under 18 must be accompanied by an adult. To sign up a group of 10 or more volunteers please reach out to stewardship@parks.nyc.gov.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúNature‚Äôs Workshop: Wild Plant Bouquet Making‚Äù

10 to 11:30 a.m.

Mother Carter Garden in Baisley Pond Park, Queens

‚ÄúDiscover the art of crafting beautiful bouquets using wild grasses and plants. Join our knowledgeable Rangers on an identification walk and learn how to create stunning natural bouquets that will remain vibrant both fresh and dried.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúField Guide: Deep Looking: Points Of Connection Abound‚Äù

11 a.m. to 1 p.m.

Socrates Sculpture Park, Queens

‚ÄúFacilitated by Christina Delfico of iDig2Learn

Looking up at tree limbs or down to vast root systems below ground, we‚Äôll explore nature‚Äôs exchange to unlock the hidden relatedness in our midst.

Lightning strikes give the soil nitrogen, and earth-bound fungi hug tightly to tree root tips teasing out sugars and sending back nutrients a tree could never absorb without the aid of their mycelium friends.

Come explore the park and the complex connections aboveground and underground with artists of Socrates and iDig2Learn‚Äôs founder. Together we will share the latest science and create a colorful visual web of ribbon art in the River Birch grove to better understand the interconnectedness all living things do to heal, trade and repair.

Website: https://www.idig2learn.org/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/idig2learn/?hl=en‚Äú

Cost: Free! Get tkts here.

‚ÄúColor Theory In Nature‚Äù

11 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.

Pelham Bay Nature Center in Pelham Bay Park, Bruckner Boulevard and Wilkinson Avenue, Bronx

‚ÄúJoin the Urban Park Rangers on a fun and educational nature walk to learn all about how plants and animals use color in their everyday lives!‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúPerformance and Workshop with Mark Morris Dance Group‚Äú

11 a.m. to 4 p.m.

Brooklyn Bridge Park, Pier 1 Harbor View Lawn, Manhattan

‚ÄúPresented by Brooklyn Bridge Park Conservancy, Mark Morris Dance Group (MMDG) returns to Brooklyn Park Bridge, for a special, outdoor performance and an all-ages family-friendly workshop.‚Äù

Check brooklynbridgepark.org for the repertoire and details of the workshop. This event is subject to change to weather or other extenuating circumstances.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúForging Maritime Metals‚Äù

12 to 2 p.m.

Pier 16, South Street Seaport, Manhattan

‚ÄúVisit the Seaport Museum for drop-in metalworking demonstrations that delve into the crucial role of blacksmiths during the Age of Sail, both on land and aboard ships at sea. These events will spark interest into the maritime blacksmithing trade and provide visitors with insight into the construction and maintenance of historic vessels, like the 1885 tall ship Wavertree.

Metalworker and long-time Seaport Museum volunteer Barry Greene will enlighten viewers about the tools and materials employed by smiths. Through live showcases, he will demonstrate the historical art of crafting rivets, spikes, and various tools.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúGrill in the Garden‚Äù

12:30 to 7 p.m.

Lincoln Avenue, Lincoln Avenue The Bronx

‚ÄúLets Go. Enjoy food, drinks, good music & great vibes. Plant Based BBQ food in a luscious Floral Garden Smack Dab in the Heart of The City.‚Äù

Cost: Free! For more info and to get tkts, go here.

‚ÄúHistoric Tea Party‚Äù

1 to 2 p.m.

H.H. Biddle House in Conference House Park, 70 Satterlee Street, Staten Island

‚ÄúJoin the Rangers and travel back in time in the historic Biddle House. Learn the historical significance that tea has played throughout history and culture. Try an assortment of natural teas and lemonades from plants seen in the park while wearing your best Victorian dress! All materials provided by the Rangers.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúNational Film Registry Series: Don Siegel‚Äôs Dirty Harry (1971)‚Äù

2 p.m.

Seward Park Library, 192 East Broadway, Manhattan

‚ÄúA rooftop sniper named Scorpio has killed twice. Streetwise San Francisco police detective Harry Callahan will nail the perp one way or another‚Äîno matter what ‚Äòthe system‚Äô prescribes. The film‚Äôs story is based on the Zodiac Killer murders of the early seventies. (102 minutes)

‚ÄîRobert Cashill, Cineaste.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

(Image Source: Wikipedia.org)

‚ÄúCocktails on the Farm‚Äù

5 to 8 p.m.

Urban Farm in Randall‚Äôs Island Park, Manhattan

‚ÄúJoin us for an evening of farm-to-high table cocktails and mocktails at the Urban Farm. Purchase and sample beverages infused with farm fresh flavors, savor freshly harvested snacks, and mingle with new and old friends. Ages 21+!‚Äù *Cheap Chick in the City Cheap Trick* ‚ÄúOne drink will be free for the first 150 participants.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚ÄúRCTA Summer Concert Series: August 3rd, 2024, Paul DeCoster‚Äù (This event repeats every week on Saturday between 6/22/2024 and 8/10/2024.)

7 p.m.

96th Street Tennis Courts in Riverside Park, Manhattan

‚ÄúThese FREE Concert evenings are highlighted by picnics and good company as live entertainment enthusiasts gather on the north lawn of the tennis courts to enjoy a variety of musical acts. The Sunset Concert Series is a prime example of how the RCTA aims to provide community engagement experiences for all. All Shows start at 7pm.‚Äù

Cost: Free!

‚Äú‚ÄòMUCH ADO ABOUT NOTHING‚Äò Screening‚Äú

8 to 10:30 p.m.

Queens Night Market at the New York Hall of Science in Flushing Meadows Park, Queens

‚ÄúFree Outdoor Screening of The Public‚Äôs Free Shakespeare in the Park production recorded live by THIRTEEN for Great Performances on PBS

‚ÄòMUCH ADO ABOUT NOTHING‚Äô

By William Shakespeare

Directed by Kenny Leon
